title: What is the difference between symphonic rock and symphonic metal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Symphonic Rock: Symphonic rock hasn’t been much of a genre. I mean yes, its a genre but it was mixed up with progressive rock. Back at the 60s, when some rock bands who were inspired by classical music were using their classical music and rock music and used some different instruments such as flute, keyboards with unique playing, cello, violin etc. It created a powerful back background music with soft rock music. For example this song, Nights In White Satin - Moody Blues  Instead of just playing lead guitar and heavy snare drum beats, the song focused more on background music. The flute solo in this song is another to notice, it has a very unique sound. The backing vocals also created another background theme which enriched the song. Symphonic Metal: Symphonic metal is a huge genre of metal music. It is mainly associated with power metal and classical music. Symphonic metal uses power metal riffs and solos, and it features opera vocals. Usually female vocals. It also uses keyboards to create a strong, powerful, rich backing music. You will see that a lot of power metal bands are symphonic metal and a lot of symphonic metal bands are power metal. More or less every symphonic metal band is related to power metal. A song for example, Ghost Love Score - Nightwish  Its one of the most famous symphonic metal songs. It used a powerful opera vocals, and it has many keyboards parts. So, the main differences between these genres are, Symphonic rock is a genre of rock. Symphonic Metal is a genre of metal.Symphonic rock uses more elements of progressive rock. Symphonic metal uses elements of power metal.Symphonic metal has opera vocals. Symphonic rock also has. But not like symphonic metal.Similarities Both focuses on background music.Both of these are classical inspired genres.Both of these have heavy uses of keyboards. And also other unique instruments.

Symphonic rock has, first of all, not to be confused with Progressive rock. Symphonic rock uses prog rock items, such as items of classical music in their sound, and some bands even use orchestras or synthesizers. (Bands:Yes/Genesis/Pink Floyd) Instead, Symphonic metal combines Metal with classical music, especially keyboards. Some Symphonic bands have got one clear singer and one growler singer. (Bands: Epica/Nightwish/Apocalyptica)
